intro: Alsine macrocarpa var. denudata, commonly known as the nakedleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, ovate leaves that are often covered with fine pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. This species is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent stems and efficient water retention mechanisms.
